column1: EDF302E4-9580-4841-8B0A-E47B26EB20EA#appfire#720081D3-987D-4A94-A047-B2C9B58F0C07#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2015-12-22 18:35:12#appfire#\N#appfire#2015-12-22 18:35:12#appfire#1

F1F17718-9A87-441A-8845-9DE296A7E81C#appfire#720081D3-987D-4A94-A047-B2C9B58F0C07#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2015-12-22 18:35:12#appfire#\N#appfire#2015-12-22 18:35:12#appfire#1
